Key Match Events: Oklahoma City trailed 97-92 midway through the fourth when Wiggins went to work, sparking a 25-10 run with three 3-pointers and a three-point play.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was the fourth in the NBA's 79-year history between teams on winning streaks of nine games or more.
Others: Isaiah Hartenstein, playing against his former team for the first time, contributed 14 rebounds, seven assists and four points for the Thunder. Mikal Bridges scored 24 points for New York, which had its nine-game winning streak snapped.
